info.title: Unsecured Lending CL Postback Management API
info.description:
- **API Type:** INTERNAL
- **API Risk Classification:** HIGH
- **API Owner (business):** E00509767
- **API Owner (technical):** E00509767    
- **Overview:** This is an internal API which is built to handle postback calls from Experian. This API will pass thourgh the Postback request received from Experian to APPLY.

InternalBasicAuth.description: Legacy Basic Authentication used by USCB for internal APIs

InternalTiaaUsRopcAuth.description: OAuth2.0 Resource Owner Passard Credentials (ROPC) Grant authentication using TIAA-US for internal APIs

ErrorType.description: Message details - additional operation execution information.

id.description: Generated message identifier for particular request, helping to locate server logs.

code.description: Machine readable, unique code of the message related to particular case within operation execution.

title.description: Short description of the error. Not for displaying purposes.
title.example: The authorization credentials required for this request are invalid.

detail.description: Provides additional low-level details about the error to assist with troubleshooting. Not for displaying purposes.

meta.description: Object containing non-standard meta-information about the error.

errors.description:
Contains one or more error messages and is mutually exclusive with the data item.
This will not be returned in success scenarios.

Correlation-ID.name: Correlation-ID
Correlation-ID.description:
Unique end-to-end trace ID. The initiating system (such as a Channel or 
Batch Job), must generate this unique ID, then this must be passed 
through the API call stack. This is required to maintain compliance with the current Barclays REST Standard.

X-B3-TraceId.name: X-B3-TraceId
X-B3-TraceId.description:
Unique end-to-end trace ID. The initiating system (such as a Channel or 
Batch Job), must generate this unique ID, then this must be passed 
through the API call stack.

X-B3-SpanId.name: X-B3-SpanId
X-B3-SpanId.description:
Identifies the span in the trace tree. Every request has its own SpanId 
and is generated by the Callerof the API..

X-B3-ParentSpanId.name: X-B3-ParentSpanId
X-B3-ParentSpanId.description:
Identifies the parent span in the trace tree. This is not present for the 
initiating system as that is the root of the tree. The Caller of the API 
copies this from the X-B3-SpanId header of the originating request.

X-B3-Sampled.name: X-B3-Sampled
X-B3-Sampled.description:
Sampling is a mechanism to reduce the volume of data that ends up in the tracing
system. 1 mean accept sampling, 0 mean deny.
Details https://github.com/openzipkin/b3-propagation

X-Channel-Id.name: X-Channel-Id
X-Channel-Id.description: The channel that initiated the call. Must be passed through the API stack.

X-Partner-Id.name: X-Partner-Id
X-Partner-Id.description:
The ID of the external third-party partner initiating the call. This is set by 
the External API Gateway and must be passed through the API stack.

X-User-Id.name: X-User-Id
X-User-Id.description:
The username of the person making the request. For the CCD, this is the CCD
Active Directory user. For the servicing website, this is the username of the user. This
information must be maintained between calls.
This username will be used when performing inserts or updates in the database.

Cache-Control.description: GIS mandatory response header. This is added by the Cognac sidecar.

InternalServerError.description:
Server encountered an error processing request. This should not 
happen normally, but it is a generic error message, given when 
no more specific message is suitable.

Forbidden.description: The user is not permitted to access the requested operation and it cannot be completed.

NotFound.description:
Server has not found a resource with that URI. This may be 
temporary and permanent condition. This status code is 
commonly used when the server does not wish to reveal 
exactly why the request has been refused, or when no other 
response is applicable.

BadRequest.description:
The request could not be understood by the server due to malformed 
syntax. The client SHOULD NOT repeat the request without 
modifications.

Unauthorized.description: The user could not be authenticated for this request.

TooManyRequests.description:
When a server is under attack or just receiving a very 
large number of requests from a single party, responding 
to each with a 429 status code will consume resources. 
Therefore, servers may drop connections or take other steps
instead of responding with the 429 status code, when limiting
resource usage.

ServiceUnavailable.description:
temporary maintenance of service, try again later. The implication 
is that this is a temporary condition which will be alleviated 
after some delay. If known, the length of the delay will be 
indicated in a Retry-After header. If no Retry-After is given, 
the client SHOULD handle the response as it would for a 500 response. 
Note: The existence of the 503 status code does not imply that a 
server will use it when becoming overloaded. Servers may simply 
refuse the connection.

errors.title: The request is invalid or not properly formed.
The requested operation failed because a resource associated with the request could not be found.
The request failed due to an internal error.
The user is not permitted to access the requested operation and it cannot be completed.
The user could not be authenticated for this request.
